speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: SCENE III. Venice. A street.

speaker: BASSANIO
text_entry: Enter SHYLOCK, SALARINO, ANTONIO, and Gaoler

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Gaoler, look to him: tell not me of mercy;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: This is the fool that lent out money gratis:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Gaoler, look to him.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Hear me yet, good Shylock.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I'll have my bond; speak not against my bond:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I have sworn an oath that I will have my bond.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Thou call'dst me dog before thou hadst a cause;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: But, since I am a dog, beware my fangs:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: The duke shall grant me justice. I do wonder,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Thou naughty gaoler, that thou art so fond

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: To come abroad with him at his request.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I pray thee, hear me speak.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I'll have my bond; I will not hear thee speak:

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I'll have my bond; and therefore speak no more.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I'll not be made a soft and dull-eyed fool,

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: To shake the head, relent, and sigh, and yield

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: To Christian intercessors. Follow not;

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: I'll have no speaking: I will have my bond.

speaker: SHYLOCK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: It is the most impenetrable cur

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: That ever kept with men.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Let him alone:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I'll follow him no more with bootless prayers.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: He seeks my life; his reason well I know:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I oft deliver'd from his forfeitures

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Many that have at times made moan to me;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Therefore he hates me.

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: I am sure the duke

speaker: SALARINO
text_entry: Will never grant this forfeiture to hold.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: The duke cannot deny the course of law:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: For the commodity that strangers have

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: With us in Venice, if it be denied,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Will much impeach the justice of his state;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Since that the trade and profit of the city

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Consisteth of all nations. Therefore, go:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: These griefs and losses have so bated me,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: That I shall hardly spare a pound of flesh

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To-morrow to my bloody creditor.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Well, gaoler, on. Pray God, Bassanio come

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To see me pay his debt, and then I care not!

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Exeunt
